About Maxim Golf ABOUT MAXIM GOLF Our Story Maxim Golf Solutions was formed in 2011 by Bryan Minnis when several of his contemporaries in the Kansas City golf market sought his assistance to help increase their properties‚Äô golf participation¬† At the time, Bryan served as the Director of Operations for Alvamar Country Club, a 36-hole Semi-Private operation located in Lawrence, KS. Bryan‚Äôs historical tenure as a golf and recreation operator was focused on all areas of club management with an emphasis in Sales and Marketing.¬† His work experience as a private and public golf club and recreation operator allowed him to better understand the importance of promoting club opportunities to the general public. Maxim‚Äôs first initiative was to create a membership experience that brought together several prominent daily fee golf properties in Kansas City. This process formed a membership program called ‚ÄúThe Club Membership‚Äù which allowed members to join several clubs in the area through ONE membership program that shared the revenue of the membership sales across all participating properties. The strategy was a massive success, garnering thousands of members and achieving the goal of increased revenues and market share for the select number of participating clubs.¬† Soon after, Maxim Golf expanded the Club Membership to the Des Moines and St. Louis markets, thus growing the awareness of Maxim Golf‚Äôs potential to make positive impacts throughout multiple markets. Not long after, Maxim‚Äôs leadership was being sought after to help improve other areas of club operations and Maxim Golf Management was formed. Since that time, Maxim Golf has been involved in consulting, managing, and golf course acquisition work for properties across the United States, serving hundreds of clients.¬†¬† In 2020 Maxim Golf purchased its first golf property ( Eagle Knoll Golf Club , Jefferson City, MO), adding it to its portfolio of managed clubs. Eagle Knoll, known as the ‚ÄúGolfing Gateway to the Ozarks‚Äù, became a proving ground for innovative ideas for club management and evidence that Maxim Golf was willing to put its money where its mouth is. The proven work showcases to other club owners that Maxim looks through the lens of club ownership just as its clients do. This acquisition also formed a bond with Eagle Knoll‚Äôs developer John Bode, a successful publishing magnate who became part of Maxim‚Äôs leadership team. In 2023, Maxim Golf purchased its second property, Dub‚Äôs Dread Golf Club (Kansas City, KS). Dub‚Äôs Dread is notable for once being the longest golf course in the world, adding some rich history to Maxim Golf‚Äôs portfolio of managed clubs.¬† Players such as Arnold Palmer, Jack Nicklaus, Sam Snead, Byron Nelson, and Ben Hogan walked the fairways a time ago, leaving a legacy that can‚Äôt otherwise be experienced in the Kansas City area. Today Maxim Golf strategically manages 18 properties across the Midwest and Mountain West and has a specialized interest in small-city municipal golf management paired with ownership in three properties. Maxim‚Äôs goal is to help properties in varying market sizes and geographical locations maximize their potential. Maxim is known for its outstanding agronomic practices as well as its unique ability to offer exceptional member and patron experiences. Our devotion to changing the future landscape of golf and recreation drives us to be the best for all current and future clubs. About Maxim Golf ABOUT MAXIM GOLF Our Logo Discover the meaning behind the logo of Maxim Golf and how it drives us to make long-lasting changes in the golf industry. The Name Maxim A short statement expressing general truth or conduct. We prove that our actions speak louder than words. Divot Repair Tool We put in the work, repair the blemishes, and assist properties as they reach their highest potential. Priceless Experience Our team is devoted to providing a top-tier experience from the time you enter until the time you leave. Meet Our Team Our company specializes in comprehensive management and consulting services, driven by a team of seasoned industry professionals offering expertise across all facets of golf club operation. With over 100 years of combined professional experience, our executives bring in-depth knowledge and a broad understanding of both local and national golf and recreational industry landscapes. Maxim Golf Solutions is proud to offer specialized expertise in Golf Shop Operations , Recreation Operations, Food & Beverage , Grounds & Maintenance , Sales & Marketing , Memberships , Human Resources , Accounting , Technology , and much more. Our commitment lies in translating our executive team‚Äôs collective success and industry proficiency into tailored solutions, empowering owners and operators to enhance their business operations. At Maxim, our executives convene weekly to meticulously address each client‚Äôs needs and evaluate performance, ensuring a personalized approach to every operation. Each member of our executive team shares an equal stake in our client‚Äôs success. Envelope Linkedin-in Bryan Minnis Founder and Principal Envelope Linkedin-in John Bode Principal Envelope Trey Herman Chief Operating Officer Envelope Toby Burkhart SVP of Agronomy Envelope Ben Costain VP South Region Envelope Linkedin-in Griffin Mott Director of Marketing view profile Envelope Spencer Ellsperman Director of Food & Beverage Envelope Linkedin Kailyn Smith Corporate Office Manager Envelope Linkedin Justine Lavelle Marketing and Advertising Envelope Russ Madsen Director of Purchasing/Jr. Golf Envelope Eric Brown Director of Revenue Management Envelope Kyna Smith Membership and Events Director Bryan Minnis Founder & Principal Bryan Minnis Founder & Principal Bryan is the Founder and CEO of Maxim Golf Solutions, a golf industry management and consulting firm that manages a network of 15 facilities throughout Arkansas, Missouri, Kansas, and Utah.¬† A former golf instructor, playing professional, and club professional, Bryan previously served as Head Professional, Director of Golf, and General Manager of many well-known properties such as The Wigwam Resort, The National Golf Club of Kansas City, and Alvamar.¬† Bryan is considered an industry leading authority in facility management, golf property acquisition, and sales and marketing. Email: bryanm@maxim.golf John Bode Principal John Bode Principal John formerly served as CFO of the Tribune Publishing Company.  John played the lead role in taking Tribune public on the NYSE.  He is the founder and managing director of Aerie Investments and sits on numerous boards for world leading companies.  John, currently the COO of ReaderLink, is also involved as a Maxim Golf partner and owns 70% of Eagle Knoll Golf Club in Jefferson City, MO. Email: bode@maxim.golf Trey Herman Chief Operating Officer Trey Herman Chief Operating Officer Trey graduated from Fort Hays State University with a bachelor‚Äôs degree in chemistry with thoughts of pursuing a career in medicine. His path quickly changed after graduation when he decided to follow his passion and begin golfing professionally - all while working part-time at Dub‚Äôs Dread Golf Club. He accepted the position as Head Golf Professional in 2017 where he learned alongside some of the industry‚Äôs best leaders. Over the years, he developed strong leadership skills and began leaning into his operational strengths that would ultimately mold the future of Dub‚Äôs Dread Golf Club. Email: treyh@maxim.golf Toby Burkhart Sr. Vice President of Agronomy Toby Burkhart Sr. Vice President of Agronomy Toby Burkhart has more than two decades of experience as a golf course superintendent in the state of Missouri.  He has been a 31-year member of GCSAA with 15 years of experience as a Class A Member. Toby has held such distinguished positions as Superintendent of Johnny Morris‚Äô Top of the Rock (designed by Jack Nicklaus).  Toby‚Äôs oversight of Top of the Rock brought him industry wide critical acclaim when he hosted the 2017 & 2018 PGA Bass Pro Shop Legends event at his course in Branson.  Toby has also served as Head Superintendent for Island Green Golf Club, Holiday Hills Golf Club, and John Daly‚Äôs Murder Rock.  Toby is a key component to the success of Maxim Golf.  His leadership and cooperative planning ability has enabled the superintendents within the Maxim Golf and Maxim Golf Springfield markets to flourish in their responsibilities as course caretakers. Email: tobyb@maxim.golf Ben Costain VP South Region Ben Costain VP South Region Ben Costain serves as the point person for Maxim‚Äôs Southern Region properties.  His background as a General Manger, Golf Professional, and Maintenance employee gives him unique insight into the daily operational needs of Maxim‚Äôs facilities.   Ben‚Äôs experience within the industry include work within maintenance at the prestigious Natanis Golf Course in Vassalboro, ME, followed by a golf professional position at Samoset Golf Resort in Rockport, ME.  Ben followed these stents by accepting a position as General Manager at Sable Oaks Golf Course in South Portland, ME before being recruited by GreatLIFE Golf and Fitness.  Ben was the Regional Manager of GreatLIFE‚Äôs five Wichita, KS area properties before becoming the VP of Maxim‚Äôs Southern Region.  Ben‚Äôs vast experience within the industry across multiple markets is an invaluable asset to Maxim‚Äôs management portfolio. Email: benc@maxim.golf Griffin Mott Director of Marketing Griffin Mott Director of Marketing Griffin Mott oversees marketing content for all Maxim Golf properties. He played collegiate golf at Washburn University holds degrees in Marketing and Finance, as well as a Master's in Business Administration. Griffin most recently served the title of Marketing Director for GreatLIFE Topeka as he oversaw marketing efforts for 12 locations in the Midwest. Griffin also owns his own digital marketing consulting company, Griffin Mott Consulting, on the side. His experience marketing in the golf industry and as a collegiate golfer bring extraordinary value to the Maxim team. Email: griffinm@maxim.golf Spencer Ellsperman Director of Food & Beverage Spencer Ellsperman Director of Food & Beverage Spencer Ellsperman oversees the Food & Beverage for Maxim Golf. He graduated from Ottawa University, where he played collegiate golf and earned a degree in Exercise Science. Although his original intent was to pursue nursing, Spencer‚Äôs journey led him to opportunities in golf. With over a decade of experience in the golf sector and more than 5 years in golf management, Spencer held various roles that have equipped him with a comprehensive background in hospitality. He began his career at Prairie Highlands as Assistant Manager, progressed to Blue Springs Golf Club as Assistant GM and Head Golf Pro, and is currently at Dub's Dread Golf Club, where he oversees food, beverage, and clubhouse operations. Spencer is passionate about enhancing our members and patrons experiences, fosters a vibrant atmosphere, and he remains dedicated to promoting exceptional service. Email: spencer@dubsdreadgolfclub.com Eric Brown Director of Revenue Management Eric Brown Director of Revenue Management Eric Brown has been in the golf course industry for over 25 years. Eric has served as both a Superintendent and/or GM of come of the Midwest‚Äôs best courses, including Heritage Hills Golf Course (Moberly, MO), Deer Creek (Overland Park, KS), Drumm Farm (Independence, MO). Old Orchard Country Club (Pittsfield, IL) and Blue Springs Golf Club (Blue Springs, MO).¬†

As Director of Revenue Management for all Maxim locations, Eric is responsible for analyzing sales data and market share to forecast and make recommendations, as well as set monthly and annual financial goals for Maxim. Email: ericb@maxim.golf Justine Lavelle Marketing & Advertising Justine Lavelle Marketing & Advertising Justine LaVelle is highly experienced in television production and is well respected throughout the television industry. She has produced, directed, developed and managed numerous projects in the US and all over the world. Email: justinel@maxim.golf Russ Madsen Director of Purchasing/Jr. Golf Russ Madsen Director of Purchasing/Jr. Golf Russ is a 30-year golf industry professional.  He has served in multiple capacities over the years, including GM positions at two distinguished Missouri based private clubs.  Russ has been a part of Maxim Golf since 2016 serving as Director of Jr. Golf.  Russ was formerly the General Manger of Liberty Hills Country Club.  He currently serves both the Corporate Office as Purchasing Director for Maxim Golf and as the General Manager of Green Hills Golf Club in Chillicothe, MO.  Russ also orchestrates and performs Maxim Golf‚Äôs summer Jr. Golf programs.  He has years of teaching experience with an emphasis in Jr. Golf as well as over 25 years of Merchandise expertise.  Russ handles all ordering and inventory management for the MidMO properties. Email: russm@maxim.golf Kailyn Smith Corporate Office Manager Kailyn Smith Corporate Office Manager Kailyn holds a Bachelor of Arts degree for Hospitality Administration/Management from Kansas State University.  She has practical experience in the golf industry, formerly serving in food and beverage and golf shop assistant capacities for Alvamar Country Club.  She also served as a front desk agent for Bluemont Hotels and most recently before coming to Maxim Golf, Kailyn served as Guest Relations manager for Marriott‚Äôs Hilton Head Resort.  Kailyn handles all HR, Membership Management, Corporate Compliance, and Payroll needs for the Maxim Golf network of facilities.  She works closely with property GM‚Äôs to ensure that proper implementation of Maxim Golf‚Äôs procedures and protocols are consistently and accurately implemented. Email: kailyns@maxim.golf Kyna Smith Membership and Events Director Kyna Smith Membership and Events Director Kyna holds a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Marketing from Coe College.  She is directly responsible for the promotion and sale of memberships for Maxim Golf.  Kyna also handles membership event programming for Maxim Golf, as well as non-golf event programming for the Network of properties.  Kyna also handles Stay and Play reservations for Maxim Golf Members and Patrons visiting the MidMO network of properties.  Kyna works directly with Maxim Golf property GM‚Äôs to help orchestrate and track membership sales, renewals, cancellations, and collections. Email: kynas@maxim.golf Amoriese Vicchrilli Admin. and Accounting Specialist Amoriese Vicchrilli Admin. and Accounting Specialist Amoriese has over 12 years of experience in administrative work, with a strong knowledge of the golf industry. As part of the Maxim Golf team, Amoriese is responsible for accounts payable and receivable, payroll, and various other administrative tasks. When not working, Amoriese enjoys playing golf on the occasional Saturday, creating art, spending time outdoors, and cherishing moments with loved ones. Email: amoriesev@maxim.golf John Rawdon Director of Golf John Rawdon Director of Golf John is a golf industry professional with over 25 years of experience as an elite instructor/coach, master club fitter, and golf facilities operator.  John is a Class A-1 Lifetime Member of the PGA.  His core operational competencies are rooted in sales and retail operations, vendor management, membership growth, and building long term client relationships.   He is an analytical and process improvement focused leader with a documented history of success throughout multiple markets.  His belief in personalized service for each and every patron is a major component to the bottom-line improvement strategy that drives Maxim Golf. Email: johnr@maxim.golf 12601 Hollingsworth Rd, Kansas City, KS, 66209 12601 Hollingsworth Rd, Kansas City, KS, 66209 913.954.5546 913.954.5546 info@maxim.golf info@maxim.golf Quick Links About Us Portfolio Consultations Blog Services Operational Efficiency Revenue Optimization Growth & Development Administrative Join The Club Stay up-to-date with Maxim Golf and receive our quarterly newsletters. We are the #1 golf simulator sales, design, and installation source for residential and commercial businesses. Our team is the most experienced in the industry, and we offer unrivaled golf simulator expertise and knowledge across all brands. Ace is also a golf simulator manufacturer of sewn goods, a golf event rental company, and an e-commerce retailer for the DIY simulator enthusiast. Located in Toledo, Ohio, we design and install golf simulators worldwide. Our team‚Äôs experience with the best brands in the world and unmatched knowledge ensures our customers get the simulator they want without surprises. Our Aim at Ace is to transform your simulator dream into a vibrant reality. Extensive Experience: The Ace team has over 40 years of leadership experience working for leading golf simulator brands, including TrackMan, Optishot, and aboutGolf. Industry Pioneers: Our team members were instrumental in developing the first-ever curved simulator screen. Architectural Design: Our design and engineering team has over twenty years of experience providing architectural design, blueprints, CAD renderings, and simulator integration services. Top Branded Customers: National brands include PGA Tour Superstore, 5-Iron Golf, Edwin Watts, Roger Dunn‚Äôs Golf, Xerox, Zurich Insurance, Cleveland Browns, and more. Fully Integrated Solutions: Ace provides fully integrated golf simulator solutions combining video systems, camera and radar systems, force plates, home theater, club fitting, Control4, and more. Custom Approach: Our unique expertise and custom approach helps customers avoid costly mistakes and provides excellent value. Our founders, Tom Dewire and Joe Neumeyer, built Ace Indoor Golf as a commercial and home golf simulator designer and installer and Gimme Simulators as the company‚Äôs e-commerce channel. Both businesses had one primary focus: meeting customer needs. Gimme Simulators is now part of Ace Indoor Golf but our core values remain the same. Our Values: Have a customer-first mentality Deliver above and beyond expectations Provide the highest quality product and service for great value. Bring energy and passion to each day of work Ace Indoor Golf headquarters: Ace Indoor Golf 3711 King Rd Toledo, OH  43617 United States 855.926.3283 Hours: 9 am - 4 pm EST, Monday through Friday.
